Ghost of Tsushima's system requirements are relatively demanding, but if your laptop has been handling Sekiro and Overwatch without issues, you might be in good shape.

Here are the minimum and recommended system requirements for Ghost of Tsushima:

**Minimum System Requirements:**

* OS: Windows 10 (64-bit)
* Processor: Intel Core i5-2500K or AMD FX 6300 (at least 3.3 GHz)
* RAM: 8 GB
* Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 960 or AMD Radeon R9 390 (at least 2 GB VRAM)
* Storage: 50 GB available space

**Recommended System Requirements:**

* OS: Windows 10 (64-bit)
* Processor: Intel Core i7-4770 or AMD FX 8350 (at least 3.4 GHz)
* RAM: 12 GB
* Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1060 or AMD Radeon RX 580 (at least 4 GB VRAM)
* Storage: 50 GB available space

Considering you've been playing Sekiro and Overwatch without issues, your laptop likely meets or exceeds the minimum system requirements. However, to ensure a smooth experience, I'd recommend checking your laptop's specifications against the recommended requirements.

Here are a few things to keep in mind:

* **Graphics Card:** If your laptop has a dedicated graphics card, it should be able to handle Ghost of Tsushima's graphics demands. If you're using integrated graphics, you might need to lower the graphics settings or resolution to achieve a smooth experience.
* **Processor:** A fast processor will help with the game's performance, especially during intense combat sequences.
* **RAM:** 8 GB of RAM is the minimum, but 12 GB or more is recommended. If you have 16 GB or more, you'll be in good shape.
* **Storage:** Make sure you have enough free space on your laptop's storage drive to install the game and any potential updates.

If you're still unsure, you can try checking the laptop's specifications against the system requirements and adjusting the graphics settings in the game to optimize performance. You can also look for benchmarks or reviews from other players with similar laptop configurations to get a better idea of how the game will run on your system.
